meanings.definition: A stone tool of early humans, typically rough and unpolished.
meanings.sent1: Archaeologists discovered ancient eoliths near the riverbank.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed various eoliths found in the prehistoric site.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to use eoliths as tools while playing archaeologists.
meanings.sent4: The eoliths unearthed by the researchers were like windows to the past.
meanings.sent5: The rough texture of the eoliths made them stand out among the artifacts.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of eoliths.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the eoliths artifacts to learn about early human life.
meanings.sent2: Her necklace was inspired by the eoliths patterns found in the cave paintings.
meanings.sent3: The eoliths-inspired artwork added a unique touch to the exhibition.
meanings.sent4: The eoliths design on the pottery was both primitive and intriguing.
meanings.sent5: The eoliths carvings on the wall depicted scenes from ancient times.

meanings.sent1: The craftsman decided to eoliths a new set of tools for the project.
meanings.sent2: She eoliths the stones carefully to fashion them into primitive tools.
meanings.sent3: The artist eoliths the materials skillfully to replicate ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent4: He eoliths the stones with precision, following the techniques of early humans.
meanings.sent5: They eoliths the rough stones into beautiful sculptures for the exhibition.
